blue cheese. Analysis of the Michael Government's plans by the Daily Telegraph showed that, of the 192 quangos being abolished, just 29 will disappear altogether. In an editorial, the Telegraph argued that if the intention was to save money, improve accountability and reduce the size of the state, the cull has been so badly handled that none of these ambitions may be achieved... The legislation is poorly drafted and the hoped-for savings are unlikely to materialise. The Michael Government is quickly gaining a reputation for lack of effective planning, broken promises and obfuscation. Recall the mess Michael Gove has made so far of his education brief.
